channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Jennifer Gates and fiancé Nayel Nassar secretly married in a Muslim ceremony
item.description: Microsoft heiress Jennifer Gates has married Egyptian equestrian Nayel Nassar in a secret ceremony held the night before the announced wedding date, DailyMail.com learned.

item.title: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez enjoy very passionate kiss after latest Blue Origin space flight
item.description: The billionaire Amazon founder, 57, and his rumored fiancee were pictured putting on a very public display of affection while enjoying a day out together in New York City on Friday.

item.title: Labour and Lib Dems 'WON'T stand candidates in by-election after Sir David Amess killing'
item.description: Labour and the Liberal Democrats will not stand candidates in the upcoming Southend West by-election after the killing of Tory MP Sir David Amess by a suspected terrorist, it is claimed.

item.title: Supermarkets can now REFUSE service to unvaccinated customers in Frankfurt
item.description: The health pass entry rules, announced by the central state of Hesse, allow shops to bring in the 2G rule - where premises can choose to deny entry to those who are not vaccinated.

item.title: My night in a caravan on a London roof overlooking St Paul's
item.description: When Bailey of Bristol stuck a caravan on the roof of London's One New Change overlooking St Paul's and invited us to stay there. We thought we'd better say 'yes'

item.title: Conor McGregor carries his daughter during the christening of his son Rían at The Vatican in Rome
item.description: Conor McGregor was every inch the doting dad on Saturday as he was spotted carrying his sleeping daughter out of the church following his newborn son Rían's christening at The Vatican.

item.title: David Amess terror attack suspect, 25, 'was reported to Prevent'
item.description: The suspected terrorist arrested on suspicion of murdering Conservative MP Sir David Amess in Southend may have been previously referred to Prevent, it has been claimed.

item.title: Fashion designer revealed how she added £67,000 to the value of her doer-upper house
item.description: Tasmin Blaney, 29 and Phil Bilger, 30, from Manchester, bought their first house in September 2020 for £173,000, right after Tasmin lost her job. They have now added £67,000 to its value.

item.title: Maj Gen Holmes who was found hanged at home after losing his job and marriage was 'sacked by email'
item.description: Major General Matthew Holmes, 54, was found in a bedroom at the home in Winchester, Hampshire, on October 2 - and his body was formally identified by his wife Lea, an inquest heard.

item.title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe LOSES latest appeal at one-year 'propaganda' sentence in Iran
item.description: Labour MP Tulip Siddiq said Ms Zaghari-Ratcliffe's sentence of one year plus a one-year travel ban has been 'upheld with no court hearing'.

item.title: David Amess died in terror attack: MP was killed in murder 'linked to Islamist extremism', say Met
item.description: Sir David Amess was holding a constituency surgery in Essex when a knifeman in the church launched a frenzied attack. He was wounded at least 12 times, dying at the scene.

item.title: Sir David Amess: MP's assailant queued to see him then launched his savage attack
item.description: The brutal assault on Sir David at Belfairs Methodist Church in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex, was over in seconds, but the knifeman does not appear to have been in a hurry to leave the murder scene.

item.title: Southend Tory MP David Amess dies after being stabbed multiple times by knifeman
item.description: The Tory MP for Southend West, 69, was holding a surgery at the Belfairs Methodist Church, in Eastwood Road North, Leigh-on-Sea when his attacker ran into the building wielding a knife.

item.title: Hundreds of anti-vaxxers march through London demanding 'don't jab our kids' and 'my body my choice'
item.description: Hundreds of demonstrators were seen marching by Hyde Park Corner on Saturday as they protested against mandatory vaccination passports and the vaccination of children.

item.title: Woman grabbed outside Co-op and bundled into a car as police arrest suspect on suspicion of kidnap
item.description: A middle-aged woman, in her 40s, was 'kidnapped' from outside the Co-op store on Whitley Wood Road in Reading last Sunday but managed to escape when the car slowed down in traffic.

item.title: Hillary Clinton leaves hospital after seeing Bill on his fourth night there suffering sepsis
item.description: Hillary and Chelsea Clinton were pictured visiting Bill at the hospital on his fifth day there suffering sepsis. Bill was admitted Tuesday after a urological infection developed into sepsis.

item.title: Mick Jagger makes playful dig at Paul McCartney after THOSE comments that The Beatles were 'better'
item.description: The 78-year-old singer was joined by his legendary rock group The Rolling Stones as they played in front of a celeb-filled audience at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California on Thursday.

item.title: Tobias Ellwood urges MPs to end face-to-face meetings in public following David Amess murder
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson, leader of the Labour party Sir Keir Starmer and Speaker of the Commons Sir Lindsay Hoyle were among those leaving flowers and written notes of support.

item.title: Royal blue! Queen arrives for Champions Day at Ascot
item.description: Looking perfectly poised, the monarch, dressed in a flattering blue ensemble, was seen arriving at the Ascot racehorse in Berkshire today to watch the racing events unfold.

item.title: Daily Covid infections soar by 24% in a week to 43,423
item.description: Department of Health bosses posted 43,423 new coronavirus infections today, up 24.2 per cent on last Saturday's total of 34,950. The number of people dying with the virus also increased.

item.title: David Cameron obsessive who burned down an elderly widow's house is detained under mental health act
item.description: Joseph Stead, 35, had intended to petrol bomb the ex-PM's home in the village of Dean, near Witney, Oxfordshire, but struck the house next door, a judge heard.

item.title: Calls for Southend to be made a city in honour of murdered MP David Amess' decades-long campaign
item.description: Since the year 2000, Sir David Amess had relentlessly pushed for Southend to become a city - most recently arguing that it would attract some much-needed investment post-Brexit and Covid.

item.title: Matt Hancock's surprise comeback crashes to a quick end as United Nations withdraws job offer
item.description: Matt Hancock has had his job offer at the United Nations withdrawn following uproar surrounding his appointment as an adviser for African nations.

item.title: Panicked parents phone toy shops in tears as they try to find the must-have Christmas gifts
item.description: Parents have been pictured frantically rushing around shops in Surrey, London and Hertfordshire to stock up on presents to ensure their children's stockings aren't empty this year.

item.title: Drugs gang jailed for 86 years after multi-million pound operation exposed on Channel 5 police show
item.description: Joanne Cooke, 36, was first caught with £70,000 worth of cocaine and cannabis stashed in the boot of her car when her Kia was pulled over on the A19 at Crathorne, near Yarm, north Yorkshire.

item.title: Will Young hits out at Richard Hammond for making 'homophobic jokes' on The Grand Tour
item.description: The singer, 42, has hit out at The Grand Tour host Richard Hammond for making what he regards as homophobic jokes after he watched an episode of the Amazon series.

item.title: Britain's best and worst mortgage lenders, according to their customers
item.description: Which? has revealed the results of its annual survey, which pits mortgage lenders against one another in terms of their customer service and who offers the cheapest deals.

item.title: Massive car fire at recycling plant causes delays on M6 after sending thick black smoke into the air
item.description: Ten crews of firefighters were called to the scene on Tramway Close, in Darlaston, Walsall, West Midlands, following a number of 999 calls at 11.30am today.

item.title: Motley Crue rocker Vince Neil 'taken to the hospital' after falling four feet off stage
item.description: Motley Crue's Vince Neil may have broken his ribs after falling off stage during a performance with a different band. On Friday night he fell through an opening between the stage and a speaker.

item.title: Hero stopped sex attack on woman by grabbing rapist in chokehold and punching him in the face
item.description: Steven Lequesne, 23, 'preyed' on a lone vulnerable woman who had been on a night out in Southport, Merseyside before passer-by Christopher Fletcher intervened.

item.title: Mike Tindall enjoys a fun day out with daughter Mia, seven, at Chessington World of Adventures
item.description: The former England rugby star, 42, who shares three children with the Queen's granddaughter Zara Tindall, posed up a storm alongside his eldest when attending the occasion at the Greater London resort.

item.title: Masked mob demand trans row professor is sacked in campus protest
item.description: The mob of protestors stood in a group on a patch of grass next to a footpath on the University of Sussex campus holding up signs and chanting loudly.

item.title: Dozens of migrants land on beach in Kent escorted by the RNLI days after 1,568 crossed the Channel
item.description: Three dinghies made their way to British shores, two of which were escorted by the RNLI and border patrol to Dungeness and the third was returned to Dover.

item.title: Pandemonium as four are shot at high school football game in Alabama
item.description: The shooting occurred shortly before 10pm at during the Vigor versus Williamson football game at Ladd-Peebles Stadium in Mobile, leaving one critically injured and three others wounded.

item.title: Princess Eugenie shares a sweet photo with Sarah Ferguson
item.description: The Duchess of York, who turned 62 yesterday, took to Instagram to express her gratitude to her followers and shared a selection of images.

item.title: Britney Spears threatens to expose her family: 'Lord have mercy if I ever do an interview'
item.description: Britney Spears wrote a scathing Instagram caption on Friday, in which she told her relatives they should be worried if she ever gives an interview.

item.title: Left-wing protestors take to the streets of Italy in anti-fascist rally
item.description: Left-wing former Prime Minister Massimo D'Alema took part in the demonstration on St John Lateran Square. Protestors held signs reading 'si vax' and released balloons in the square.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE Revealed: Bow and arrow 'terrorist' killed four victims in their homes in Norway rampage
item.description: Retired couple Gunnar Sauve and Liv Borge have been named locally as two of the victims of the Norwegian bow and arrow 'terrorist' who attacked people in their own homes, it has been revealed.

item.title: Probe launched after soldier, 23, was killed during military exercise on Salisbury Plain
item.description: The 23-year-old was part of a crew operating an armoured vehicle in a training area near the village of Enford, Wiltshire, when the incident happened on Friday.

item.title: Denmark stars 'held pool romp with HOTEL STAFF' ahead of crucial World Cup qualifier
item.description: The Danish FA has opened an investigation after reports in the country claimed that players allegedly romped with staff members at an Elsinore hotel last week before their qualifier against Moldova.

item.title: Four Russian tourists, aged 31 to 60, are found dead in hotel sauna at beach resort in Albania
item.description: Albanian police said the four Russian tourists were found asphyxiated in a hotel sauna in the village of Qerret late on Friday. Police did not give more details but staff at the hotel have all been questioned.

item.title: Chef, 32, charged after 'posing as police officer and searching girl, 14, as she walked to school'
item.description: Sussex Police said David Peter Young, 32, approached a 14-year-old girl in the Three Bridges area of Crawley (pictured), took her to a nearby area away from the road and searched her clothing.

item.title: Michael Caine announces likely retirement from acting at 88
item.description: Sir Michael Caine announced in an interview this week that he is probably retiring from acting now at the age of 88. The legendary screen star was on BBC Radio 5 to promote Best Sellers.

item.title: French diplomats say Boris Johnson 'is populist who won't keep his word if it will cost him at home'
item.description: Politicians in Paris believe the prime minister is a populist who wants to use France as a scapegoat to keep pushing his Brexit agenda and he has no interest in solving issues in the relationship.

item.title: Bali, Indonesia: Magnitude 4.8 earthquake kills at least three people
item.description: The 4.8 magnitude quake hit just before dawn - causing locals to run outdoors in a panic. It struck as the Indonesian island begins to reopen to tourism as the Covid pandemic subsides.
item.media:description: A woman walks past houses by Lake Batur which were damaged by an earthquake-triggered landslide in Bangli, on the island of Bali, Indonesia, Saturday, Oct. 16, 2021. A few people were killed and another several were injured when a moderately strong earthquake and an aftershock hit the island early Saturday. (AP Photo/Dewa Raka)

item.title: Ballerina reveals how she faced racism, sexual assault and fat shaming in explosive memoir
item.description: Dancer and actress Georgina Pazcoguin, 37, who is of Filipina and Italian descent, has penned an explosive memoir titled Swan Dive: The Making of a Rogue Ballerina.

item.title: Sister company of lab that wrongly told up to 45,000 people they didn't have Covid probed
item.description: Immensa Health Clinic Ltd is run by Dante Labs chief executive Andrea Riposati. The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) last month announced it is investigating Dante Labs over its PCR tests.

item.title: Can YOU spot the panda among the ghosts?
item.description: The graphic is the work of Hungarian viral cartoonist Gergely Dudas, better known as Dudolf , who is known for delighting fans around the world with his playful puzzles.

item.title: Boy, 16, charged with murdering Afghan refugee, 18, who was stabbed to death on playing fields
item.description: The Metropolitan Police said a 16-year-old boy from Hammersmith and Fulham was charged with murder on Friday. Hazrat Wali, 18, was fatally stabbed in Twickenham on Tuesday.

item.title: Jesy Nelson finds solace in recording studio after blackfishing row as she achieves top 5 single
item.description: The singer, 30, has found solace in the recording studio after getting caught up in a blackfishing row following the release of her debut solo single Boyz last week.

item.title: Husband appears in court charged with murdering wife who died after being pulled from burning car
item.description: Thomas Rainey, 59, has been charged with the murder of Katrina Rainey at the family farm in Co Londonderry on Tuesday.

item.title: Five thugs face life in prison after being found guilty of drive by murder of shop owner
item.description: Abdul Rahman Abubaker, 24, (pictured) suffered catastrophic injuries after being blasted with a shotgun in Birmingham and died hours later in hospital.

item.title: Serving police officer is arrested on suspicion of sexual assault
item.description: The officer, 48, of States Police in Jersey, was not on duty at the time of the alleged assault at around 10.15pm in the the Trafalgar pub in St Aubin, Jersey, last Saturday. He is in police custody.

item.title: Police release efit in hunt for attacker who tried to choke woman with a metal chain
item.description: The Metropolitan Police have released an e-fit (pictured) as they hunt for the man that they believe may have been involved in a 'terrifying attack' on a woman in a park in east London.

item.title: Prisoner gets another six months added to his sentence for slapping female prison officer's backside
item.description: Paul Morgan, 66, sexually assaulted the woman four times while serving a sentence in HMP Wormwood Scrubs in west London on July 3 this year.

item.title: Girl, 13, dies after being hit by a car as she crossed road near roundabout in Kent
item.description: The teenager was hit by a blue Vauxhall Astra by the Whitfield roundabout (pictured) in Kent shortly before 8pm on Friday and police are appealing for witnesses.

item.title: Sean Penn's wife of 15 months Leila George, 29, files for divorce
item.description: Sean Penn's wife of just over a year, Leila George has filed for divorce, but no details of what led to the split have been provided at this time.

item.title: Ex-Bishop of Rochester defends his decision to convert to Catholicism amid child abuse probes
item.description: Michael Nazir-Ali, who was the Bishop of Rochester from 1994 until 2009, could be ordained as a priest as early as next month after spending 'some years' considering the change.

item.title: Homeowners share ideas for getting revenge on neighbours
item.description: The Mumsnet thread was sparked by a British homeowner who revealed they had reached the end of their tether with the people living next door after a number of 'awful issues' over lockdown.

item.title: Used cars: Models that sell for 60% more than six months ago
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Using exclusive data provided by cap hpi, we reveal the 20 older cars that have risen in value most in six months, with used Toyota Auris hybrids and Vauxhall Zafiras up by almost 60%.

item.title: Queen Letizia of Spain stuns in a recycled Felipe Varela gem-encrusted dress
item.description: Letizia looked typically elegant as she stepped out with her husband King Felipe, 53, for the 70th edition of the Planeta Novel Prize at the National Art Museum of Catalonia.

item.title: Consumers spent a fifth more on energy AND fuel in the past fortnight
item.description: Consumers spent a fifth more on household energy and fuel in the last fortnight, new research has revealed.

item.title: 'The advice is not to see constituents on our own': What Sir David Amess wrote after Jo Cox murder
item.description: In a book published last year, Sir David described how he and other MPs altered the way they interacted with the public - particularly in constituency surgeries.

item.title: Crusader of backbenches Sir David Amess who loved Strictly - but not Eurovision
item.description: Murdered Conservative MP Sir David Amess first entered political folklore during the 1992 election when his famously Tory Essex seat was expected to fall to Neil Kinnock's Labour.

item.title: Covid lie spreaders: How a small cabal of anti-vaxxers are cashing in and risking countless lives
item.description: :U.S. TV producer Del Bigtree, osteopath and entrepreneur Joseph Mercola and Robert F. Kennedy Jr, nephew of former U.S. president John F. Kennedy.are influential anti-vaxxers.

item.title: Pentagon says it will offer 'condolence payments' to relatives of ten Afghans killed in drone strike
item.description: Pentagon spokesman John Kirby said in a statement that the Defense Department was also working with the State Department to help surviving family members of the blast relocate.

item.title: Apple FIRES head of '#AppleToo' group for 'non-compliance' after she deleted files from work devices
item.description: Janneke Parrish, a program manager for Apple Maps working in Austin, Texas, led a protest movement about working conditions. On Thursday she was fired after deleting work documents.

item.title: William Shatner fires back at George Takei for feuding with 'Star Trek' colleague over space trip
item.description: 'Don't hate George,' Shatner wrote. 'The only time he gets press is when he talks bad about me. He claims 50+ years ago I took away a camera angle that denied him 30 more seconds of prime time TV.'

item.title: Airplane! writer and director David Zucker says film could never be made today
item.description: David Zucker, who wrote and directed comedy classics like 'Airplane!' and the 'Naked Gun' series, bemoans today's market where many of his indelible one liners couldn't fly.

item.title: Row over allegations Boris and Carrie Johnson 'broke Covid lockdown rules' last Christmas
item.description: Spokesmen for the pair said claims they breached Covid-19 lockdown rules by allowing a friend to stay over Christmas was untrue amid fury over claims wife 'models' image on Kate Middleton.

item.title: Unions threatening Christmas chaos with HGV driver walkouts over pay and new rules for EU drivers
item.description: Union leaders said the treatment of British HGV drivers was 'nothing short of a disgrace', as experts warned new plans to allow more foreign hauliers into the UK would 'undercut' British business.

item.title: BBC boss Tim Davie 'blocked a leading diversity champion from getting a top job at the corporation'
item.description: A leading diversity campaigner-Marcus Ryder- missed out on a top BBC job after director-general Tim Davie effectively 'blocked' his appointment, the Mail can reveal.

item.title: Afghan translators and families forced to flee across borders are finally whisked to safety
item.description: Following the fall of their homeland in August, many of those left stranded when Western evacuation flights ended made the decision to leave, embarking on journeys fraught with danger.

item.title: AMANDA PLATELL: It's a sin for Channel 4 to stoop to such depths with 'My First Threesome'
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: My First Threesome raises serious questions over the future of the channel, created by Margaret Thatcher to provide cutting-edge shows, funded by advertising.

item.title: The story behind Adele's first song in six years as LIZ JONES and ALISON BOSHOFF give their verdicts
item.description: With the release of Easy On Me, Adele is allowing just a glimpse of her A-list life. From her less-than-a-year-long marriage to her passion for exercise, ALISON BOSHOFF reports...

item.title: DR MICHAEL MOSLEY: Here's why boosting bacteria in your breasts could cut the risk of cancer
item.description: DR MICHAEL MOSLEY: Breast cancer tissue typically contains lower levels of bacteria called Lactobacillus, which produce anti-inflammatory compounds.

item.title: Huntsman who gave lectures on how to covertly carry out illegal fox hunts is ordered to pay £3,500
item.description: Mark Hankinson, the director of the Masters of Foxhounds Association, was found guilty at Westminster Magistrates' Court of encouraging or assisting others to commit an offence.

item.title: Netflix paid only £4million in UK tax last year despite earning £1billion from British subscribers
item.description: Netflix paid only around £4million in UK tax last year despite raking in £1billion from British subscribers. The US streaming giant had its best year in 2020 due to lockdowns.

item.title: British Army trials futuristic glasses with a monitoring system to track soldiers' eyes
item.description: The British Army seems to be taking inspiration from the 1960's sci-fi puppet show, the brainchild of Thunderbirds creators Gerry and Sylvia Anderson.

item.title: IAN BIRRELL: It's vital we protect the soul of our democracy
item.description: IAN BIRRELL: Yet again, Britain shudders in collective shock as a Member of Parliament is slaughtered while doing their job.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell has already been convicted by 'court of public opinion', says her brother Ian
item.description: The ex-tycoon, 65, maintains that his sister is 'innocent' as she awaits an imminent trial on sexual abuse and trafficking charges alleged to have taken place between 1994 and 2004.

item.title: ADRIAN THRILLS: Adele's Easy On Me is another belter
item.description: ADRIAN THRILLS: Easy On Me is now here - and it's the kind of yearning, happy-sad ballad that has been Adele's stock-in-trade ever since she wowed the nation at the Brits ten years ago.

item.title: BRIAN VINER reviews biopic King Richard about two star sisters' tiger dad
item.description: BRIAN VINER: King Richard, tells the extraordinary tale of one man's obsession, of how a pair of tennis superstars were forged in the crucible of their father's white-hot ambition.

item.title: Priti Patel will be granted powers to ban a country's citizens from UK if they refuse deportations
item.description: The Home Secretary will be able to suspend visas entirely, impose a £190 surcharge on applications to come to the UK or increase visa processing times in a bid to encourage co-operation.

item.title: Pay-by-the-mile road pricing plans are DROPPED
item.description: The Treasury has been examining proposals for the introduction of road pricing to replace the £30billion in lost fuel duty that will result from a move to electric vehicles.

item.title: Man surprises his ex girlfriend by paying off her ENTIRE mortgage
item.description: Shaun Nyland, from Newport, Wales surprised his ex girlfriend, Cat Keenan, on her 31st birthday as a thank you for being 'the best mum ever' to their son and captured the moment on TikTok.

item.title: PICTURED: Police constable, 51, who was FIRED for underpaying on charity box of Jaffa Cakes
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: PC Chris Dwyer, 51, put two 5p coins in the cash tin and took two Jaffa Cake packets being sold for 50p each at a charity stall at a police station in Halifax, West Yorkshire.

item.title: Harry and Meghan team up with 'ethical' investment bank but fund is not quite as pious as advertised
item.description: GUY ADAMS: Harry and Meghan have just been unveiled as 'impact partners' in an ultra-fashionable Wall Street firm named Ethic - a company with extensive investments in fracking.

item.title: Mom's security footage captures home invader undoing his pants as goes into her daughter's bedroom
item.description: Thomas Marnets, 52, was arrested after security footage showed him breaking into a home in Holiday, Florida, before 1am. He undid his pants and stood in a young girl's room.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: Why did my cold wife lie to me for 58 years?
item.description: This week, Bel advises a man whose late wife's friend has claimed she had only married him to have children.

item.title: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: Rubbish on the streets, inflation set to soar - how worried should we be?
item.description: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: In recent weeks, soaring oil prices, petrol queues, surging energy bills, empty supermarket shelves, and talk of Christmas toy shortages have made life feel very Seventies.

item.title: Tadpoles can survive without BREATHING after scientists inject their hearts with algae
item.description: Tadpoles without the ability to breathe on their own were kept alive after algae was injected into their hearts. The algae moved through blood vessels to the brain and light shined on them created oxygen.

item.title: Disgraced police officer avoids jail after he left female colleague crying after harassing her
item.description: Mark Knights harassed the officer at Matlock police station between August and October 2020, while he was being investigated for headbutting a member of the public while on duty in Derbyshire.

item.title: St John's College, Cambridge breaks 350-year-old tradition allowing women to become choristers
item.description: St John's College, Cambridge will break a 350-year tradition by permitting girls and women to become choristers (pictured) for the first time from next year, a move dubbed 'pioneering'.

item.title: Man in his 50s dies after house collapses during 'gas explosion' in Chorley
item.description: Emergency services were called to reports of a house fire on Kirkby Avenue in Clayton-le-Woods, Lancashire, at about 1.20pm on Friday. Police confirmed one person died in the incident.

item.title: The man at the centre of Adele's heartbreak anthem: Who is her ex Simon 'Swampy' Konecki?
item.description: Adele and Simon Konecki married in 2018, but the relationship quickly soured and they separated in 2019- with the British superstar revealing all about their breakup in her latest album, 30.

item.title: Dive buddies! Water-loving Staffy plunges off cliff alongside his owner in adorable footage
item.description: The five-year-old English Staffordshire Bull Terrier is called Blu Estremo and the duo performed the synchronised jump on Giannutri Island in Tuscany.

item.title: Detective in charge of probe into Grindr killer Stephen Port's first victim 'made mistakes'
item.description: Det Sgt Martin O'Donnell told inquest jurors how he did not share intelligence with colleagues about a previous allegation that Port (pictured) plied a young man with drugs before raping him.

item.title: Hooters Girls slam chain's 'TINY' new uniform shorts while showing off the revealing 'panties'
item.description: The restaurant chain, which was officially founded in 1983, introduced a new uniform for its staff this month, including a small pair of shorts.

item.title: Price of petrol hits a NINE YEAR HIGH of 140.22p per litre
item.description: Average UK petrol prices are now just 2p off the record high seen in April 2012. Prices have risen by nearly 26p-a-litre in just 12 months, from 114.50p on this day last year - up 22%.

item.title: Apple takes down popular Koran app in China after it allegedly hosted illegal texts
item.description: Apple took down a popular Koran app in China after it allegedly hosted 'illegal religious texts,' though the developer said China 'requires additional documentation' for mainland apps to work.

item.title: Heathrow Express turns carriage into 'tranquil train' to host live YOGA class to calm passengers
item.description: Heathrow Express travellers were yesterday treated to sessions with influencer Celest Pereira, who developed a 'seat-yoga' routine so travellers can exercise from their seats.

item.title: NASA's $981 million Lucy asteroid mission to launch tomorrow
item.description: The spacecraft is scheduled to blast off on Saturday at 05:34 ET (10:34 BST) on a United Launch Alliance Atlas V rocket from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

item.title: Stepmother 'killed' boy, six, then told 999 operator 'He's knocked himself out', court hears
item.description: Arthur Labinjo-Hughes was allegedly murdered by his father and his partner after enduring months of abuse in Solihull.

item.title: Scientists identify 46 harmful effects of social media use
item.description: Most research has focused on the benefits of social networks, experts at University of Technology Sydney claim - but this means negative effects of sites like Facebook and Twitter are overlooked.

item.title: New Zealand's official WIZARD is fired after joking about hitting women
item.description: In April, Ian Brackenbury Channell told a comedy current affairs show that he would 'never strike a woman because they bruise too easily' - a remark which drew considerable criticism.

item.title: Parents' fury as Eton pupils given remote lessons and told to isolate in houses amid Covid outbreak
item.description: Approximately 50 students were told to remain in their boarding houses at the historic school in Eton, Berkshire, as they were switched over to remote learning sessions at the start of the week.

item.title: Covid has made us more miserable than ever before
item.description: Data from the Office for National Statistics revealed that life satisfaction in the UK dropped to the lowest levels ever recorded, while anxiety soared to its highest ever level.

item.title: Nuking an incoming asteroid COULD actually work, study shows
item.description: A megaton nuke, exploding near the surface of an asteroid would destroy it without leaving thousands of fragments, a team from Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, Maryland found.

item.title: Addison Lee reveals plans to recruit 1,000 drivers in London
item.description: Between August and September, Addison Lee said its passenger car journeys in London increased by more than 40%.

item.title: Amazon denies reports that internal documents show it copied products and rigged search results
item.description: Denying the claims of rip-off products and search results manipulation, Amazon said the allegations were 'incorrect and unsubstantiated'.

item.title: Spiritual spas and hotels: These retreats will help you see the world and yourself in a new light
item.description: Spas and hotels all over the world offer packages that tackle your psyche as well as your cellulite. They certainly aren't for everyone, but if you feel the call for a life overhaul, here's where to start...
